titleInfo.title: Letter to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from John Beaumont at Bushire

physicalDescription.extent: The item is damaged and has a hole in the text.

mods.abstract: The letter discusses packets received from Bussora [Basra] and sent onwards to Carim Caun [Karim Khan]. The problems of company staff in Bussora and negotiations with Carim Caun on the matter are detailed. The arrivals of the Commerce Captain James Scott and the Betsey Snow Captain David Phillips are reported. The letter states that monthly accounts for August to February are enclosed and discusses other financial matters.
